title: AI-Powered Resume Workshop
description: Learn how to leverage ChatGPT and AI tools to create ATS-friendly resumes that get interviews.
fullDescription: In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn the right way to use AI for resume writing without losing your authentic voice. We'll cover keyword optimization, quantifying achievements, and tailoring resumes for specific roles. Bring your current resume and a job posting you're interested in!

agenda.title: Introduction to ATS systems
agenda.description: How applicant tracking systems screen resumes

agenda.title: AI Keyword Strategy
agenda.description: Using ChatGPT to identify impactful keywords from job descriptions

agenda.title: Hands-on Workshop
agenda.description: Rewriting bullet points with AI assistance

speakers.name: Jeremy Schifeling
speakers.title: Former LinkedIn Education Lead
speakers.bio: Jeremy served in leadership roles at LinkedIn and Khan Academy (OpenAI's first education partner). He's helped thousands of job seekers land roles at top tech companies.

title: LinkedIn Profile Optimization for AI Careers
address: GITC Building, 218 Central Ave, Newark, NJ 07102
description: Transform your LinkedIn profile to attract AI/ML recruiters with proven strategies from industry experts.
fullDescription: Your LinkedIn profile is often the first impression recruiters have of you. This workshop covers everything from crafting compelling headlines to showcasing AI projects in your Featured section. You'll leave with a complete action plan to optimize your profile.

agenda.title: About Section
agenda.description: Writing an engaging summary that tells your story

speakers.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
speakers.title: Career Coach & AI Consultant
speakers.bio: Dr. Chen has helped over 500 students land roles at Google, Meta, and AI startups. She previously worked as a data scientist at IBM.

title: AI/ML Mock Interview Night
description: Practice technical and behavioral interviews with industry professionals and get real-time feedback.
fullDescription: Join us for an evening of mock interviews with professionals from top tech companies. You'll rotate through different interviewers covering technical concepts, coding challenges, and behavioral questions using the STAR method.

agenda.title: Welcome & Format
agenda.description: Brief intro to interview formats at top companies

speakers.name: David Park
speakers.title: Senior ML Engineer, Google
speakers.bio: David has conducted 200+ technical interviews at Google and mentors students transitioning into ML roles.

speakers.name: Priya Sharma
speakers.title: Data Science Manager, Meta
speakers.bio: Priya leads a team of 12 data scientists and has hired over 30 engineers in her career.

questions: What role are you preparing for?

title: Building a GitHub Portfolio That Gets Noticed
description: Learn how to transform your GitHub from a code graveyard into a professional portfolio that impresses recruiters.
fullDescription: Recruiters and hiring managers check GitHub profiles. A well-organized profile with quality projects can be the difference between getting an interview or being passed over. This workshop covers everything from profile READMEs to project documentation best practices.

agenda.title: Profile README
agenda.description: Setting up an impressive profile README

agenda.title: Project Documentation
agenda.description: Writing READMEs that tell a story

speakers.name: Marcus Johnson
speakers.title: Senior Developer Advocate, GitHub
speakers.bio: Marcus has reviewed thousands of developer portfolios and knows exactly what makes a GitHub profile stand out to recruiters.

title: AI Career Paths Panel: From Student to Professional
address: Campus Center, 150 Bleeker St, Newark, NJ 07102
description: Hear from NJIT alumni and industry professionals about their journey into AI careers and get your questions answered.
fullDescription: A panel discussion featuring AI professionals who started where you are now. Learn about different career paths in AI, from research to product to consulting, and get practical advice for your job search. Networking reception follows!

agenda.title: Career Paths
agenda.description: Research, Product, Engineering, and Consulting tracks

agenda.title: Hiring Insights
agenda.description: What hiring managers actually look for

agenda.title: Job Search Tips
agenda.description: Navigating the market as a new grad

speakers.name: Alex Rivera
speakers.title: ML Engineer, Google
speakers.bio: NJIT '19 alumni, now building recommendation systems at Google. Transitioned from web development to ML.

speakers.name: Michelle Wong
speakers.title: Data Scientist, JPMorgan
speakers.bio: Leads fraud detection ML models. Previously at Bloomberg after completing her MS at NJIT.

speakers.name: James Okonkwo
speakers.title: AI Consultant, Deloitte
speakers.bio: Helps Fortune 500 companies implement AI solutions. NJIT '18 alumni.

speakers.name: Dr. Lisa Zhang
speakers.title: Research Scientist, NVIDIA
speakers.bio: Works on large language models. PhD from MIT, frequently collaborates with NJIT researchers.

questions: Which career path interests you most?

title: ChatGPT for Student Productivity
description: Master advanced prompting techniques to 10x your productivity in coding, writing, and learning.
fullDescription: Go beyond basic ChatGPT usage and learn advanced prompting strategies that will transform how you work on projects, study, and prepare for interviews. Includes hands-on exercises and prompt templates you can use immediately.

agenda.title: How LLMs Work
agenda.description: Brief overview of language model fundamentals

speakers.name: Dr. Ethan Mollick
speakers.title: Professor, Wharton School
speakers.bio: Author of 'Co-Intelligence: Living and Working with AI' and one of TIME's Most Influential People in AI 2024. Co-director of Wharton's Generative AI Lab.

title: Job Club Kickoff: Your AI Career Roadmap
description: Introduction to Job Club and creating your personalized AI career roadmap for 2025.
fullDescription: Our kickoff event introduced the Job Club community and helped members create personalized career roadmaps. We covered the essential professional assets every AI job seeker needs and how to build them systematically.

speakers.name: Job Club Team
speakers.title: NJIT AI Career Accelerator
speakers.bio: The Job Club founding team includes career coaches, industry mentors, and NJIT faculty dedicated to helping students break into AI careers.

title: NJIT AI Exploration Day
address: Campus Center, 150 Bleeker St, Newark, NJ 07102
description: University-wide event exploring AI's role in education, work, and society with keynote by Dr. Ethan Mollick.
fullDescription: AI Exploration Day was an immersive day of learning that explored AI's rapidly evolving role in education, work, and society. The event featured keynotes, breakout sessions across 7 topic tracks, student showcases, and panel discussions with industry leaders.

agenda.title: Opening Keynote
agenda.description: Dr. Ethan Mollick on AI in Education

speakers.name: Dr. Ethan Mollick
speakers.title: Professor, Wharton School
speakers.bio: Author of 'Co-Intelligence: Living and Working with AI' and one of TIME's Most Influential People in AI 2024.

title: Group Resume Review Session
description: Live resume reviews and feedback from career coaches and industry professionals.
fullDescription: Members submitted resumes for live review and feedback. Our panel of career coaches provided actionable advice on improving content, formatting, and ATS optimization for AI/ML roles.

agenda.title: Common Mistakes
agenda.description: Patterns we noticed and how to fix them

speakers.name: NJIT Career Services
speakers.title: Career Development Services
speakers.bio: NJIT's Career Development Services team brings decades of experience helping students land internships and full-time roles at top companies.
